intro: Alkanna tubulosa, commonly known as the Indian madder, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright red pigments in its roots, which have been historically used for dyeing textiles and cosmetics. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are typically pink to red in color. Alkanna tubulosa thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
